Have you ever felt uneasy while reading blogs or news articles that come across as biased, lacking accuracy, and designed just to provoke? With FECA, you can navigate the web and interact with content through a lens that is more balanced and critical.

FECA is a dictionary-style plugin that helps users understand feminist terminologies  (and terminologies 'through' a feminist lens) when browsing the web. It was created to assist and encourage more people in reading web content from a feminist perspective.

In this version of the plugin, you can highlight and search for terms related to gender-based violence. When activated, our plugin conveniently highlights keywords on your active tab based on a 'themed list' from Femiwiki.com. This list can be modified and added to by any contributing members of the Wiki. If you find any words that are missing you can help improve the wiki and the plugin by sending us your suggestions. We plan to hold regular Femiwiki edit-a-thons with these suggestions, thereby improving the database of feminist terms over time.
